From pseudes and prophetes; a spurious prophet, i.e. Pretended foreteller or religious impostor.

Apparently a primary word; a people.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

4.str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

4.str2: To thrust down to Tartarus or Gehenna. From Tartaros; to incarcerate in eternal torment.

4.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

From a compound of a and a presumed selges; licentiousness.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

18.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
18.str2: To allure, entice (by a bait). From the base of dolos; to entrap, i.e. delude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

18.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
18.str2: To flee from, escape. From apo and pheugo; to escape.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

18.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
18.str2: From ana and strepho; to overturn; also to return; by implication, to busy oneself, i.e. Remain, live.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Feminine of planos; objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
19.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
19.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
19.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
19.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Corruption, destruction, decay, rottenness, decomposition. From phtheiro; decay, i.e. Ruin.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

19.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: To enslave. From doulos; to enslave.

19.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: From the same as hetton; to make worse, i.e. Vanquish; by implication, to rate lower.

20.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To flee from, escape. From apo and pheugo; to escape.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pollution, defilement; a stain. From miaino; foulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To enfold, entangle; pass: To be involved in. From en and pleko; to entwine, i.e. involve with.

20.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: From the same as hetton; to make worse, i.e. Vanquish; by implication, to rate lower.
This; he, she, it.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.

20.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Worse, more severe. Irregular comparative of kakos; from an obsolete equivalent cheres; more evil or aggravated.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.

21.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Stronger, more excellent. Comparative of a derivative of kratos; stronger, i.e. better, i.e. Nobler.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
21.str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
21.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

22.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A cryptic saying, an allegory; a proverb, figurative discourse.

22.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: To happen, occur, meet. From sun and the base of basis; to walk together, i.e. Concur.
Unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful. TRUE.
A dog, universally despised in the East. A primary word; a dog.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
22.str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Vomit. From a comparative of ek and a presumed erao; vomit, i.e. Food disgorged.
A hog, boar, or sow. Apparently a primary word; a hog.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Feminine Singular

22.str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A place of wallowing. From kulioo; a wallow, i.e. Filth.
Mud, mire, filth. Of uncertain derivation; mud.
